summary: "Sometimes stocks deserve to go up on nothing, but it still seems a little quizzical to see stocks levitate like they’re doing here," the "Mad Money" host said.

headline: Ford and General Electric are headed back to the double digits, Jim Cramer says
summary: "Both have started to show green shoots, making investors more optimistic about the future for the first time in ages," the "Mad Money" host said.

summary: Third quarter earnings season kicks off on Tuesday with reports from JPMorgan,  Citigroup and Delta Air Lines.

headline: Suze Orman: An emergency fund is the most important piece to your personal investment portfolio
summary: "If you haven't learned that after this past year of what we've been through, I don't know. You have to be on another planet," personal finance expert Suze Orman told CNBC.

headline: The U.S. PC market just had its best quarter in 10 years, Gartner says
summary: The increase reflects the strongest quarterly PC demand from consumers in five years, as consumers around the world clamor for new laptops and desktops for home entertainment and remote schooling amid the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

headline: SoftBank's Rajeev Misra says Vision Fund 2 is backing a SPAC
summary: The trendy investment vehicle will give the Vision Fund a new way of investing in private companies and give public investors access to SoftBank's portfolio manager picks.
